p.College of Business Administration\nDepa:
College of Business Administration
Department of Finance
Business Administration I (BS1), 409
p.Students seeking advising must go to Bus: Students seeking advising must go to Business Administration II (BA2), 101.
p.Open to College of Business students maj: Open to College of Business students majoring in Accounting, Economics, and Finance and College of Engineering & Computer Science students. This certificate requires three additional hours beyond the finance major program. They are intended to allow students to develop specializations in areas of interest. Certificates will be awarded only at the time of degree completion.

li.Completion of FIN 3403 with a \"B\" or b: Completion of FIN 3403 with a "B" or better prior to application to the minor.
li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.

courseSection0.text:
College of Business Administration
Department of Finance
Business Administration I (BS1), 409
Students seeking advising must go to Business Administration II (BA2), 101.
Open to College of Business students majoring in Accounting, Economics, and Finance and College of Engineering & Computer Science students. This certificate requires three additional hours beyond the finance major program. They are intended to allow students to develop specializations in areas of interest. Certificates will be awarded only at the time of degree completion.
Certificate Admission Requirements
Completion of FIN 3403 with a "B" or better prior to application to the minor.
Certificate Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.

body.text:
Prerequisite Courses
Complete the following: 
FIN3403 - Business Finance (3)

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
ECO4443 - Introduction to Business Analytics (3)
FIN4450 - Foundations of FinTech (3)
FIN4451 - FinTech for Decision Makers (3)
courseSection0.text1: ECO 4443 is a prerequisite for FIN 4458 and FIN 4468.

li.Grades below \"C\" or \"S\" grades from: Grades below "C" or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
li.Courses taken at Florida College System: Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred must be formally eva: Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
li.All hours used in the certificate must b: All hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements

Grades below "C" or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
All hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
